articles.title: Tourists Throng Himachal As Plains Reel Under Heatwave, Covid Cases Decline
articles.description: Tourists have been thronging Himachal Pradesh as the heatwave has hit the plains and the second wave of COVID-19 seeing a significant decline in the country.
articles.content:
Himachal Pradesh: The surge in tourism has posed a challenge to ensure adhering of Covid protocols.

articles.title: "Tourism With A Vengeance": Himachal Cop Amid Alarming Photos Of Crowds
articles.description: The pictures of tourists thronging en masse to Himachal Pradesh have led to condemnation from several quarters on the internet as the country braces for a third Covid wave.
articles.content:
Experts have been advising against large crowds ever since the pandemic reached India.

articles.title: WFH Now "Work From Himachal": State Top Cop As Thousands Flock To Hills
articles.description: Work From Home, which has become the new normal amid the Covid pandemic, has turned into "Work From Himachal Pradesh", said the state's Director General of Police as thousands flocked to the hill state to escape the confines of their homes and heat.
articles.content:
The tourist surge is a major cause for concern for the hill states (File)

articles.author: CBC News
articles.title: Advocates say more wheelchair training needed for N.S. occupational therapists
articles.description: A recent study by Dalhousie University's head of wheelchair research says occupational therapists in the province aren't feeling prepared when it comes to offering training for wheelchair skills.
articles.content:
Andrew Jantzen uses a wheelchair to get around, but he's never received adequate training on how to use it.
"A lot of the day-to-day stuff was just never introduced to me. It was a little strange go… [+4786 chars]
